alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 5:20PM MDT until June 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms have moved north through Fremont County and become anchored along the Owl Creek Mountains. As a result, heavy rain has been falling in extreme southern Hot Springs County. This rain is likely to cause minor flooding of creeks, streams, and arroyos within the Red Canyon Creek drainage. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, extreme southern Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes and draws. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry washes. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of extreme southernn Hot Springs County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
